column4: hey, I'm trying to make a linux image using buildroot-2012.05 (latest version right now), but when I run "make busybox-menuconfig" I get "No rule to make target"
more specifically I get: make: *** No rule to make target `busybox-menuconfig'.  Stop.
When executing this command what's your present working directory? Have you tried running './configure'?
I get: bash: ./configure: No such file or directory
What's your present working directory when executing those commands.
the current directory is the buildroot folder
What's the output of 'pwd'
/home/myusername/Downloads/buildroot-2012.02
Can you pastebin the output of 'ls -la'
here - http://pastebin.com/BYpiZ5vX
I downloaded those files as an archive from here: http://buildroot.uclibc.org/download.html
the link "buildroot-2012.02.tar.gz "
Try './Config.in' './Makefile' and if that doesn't work pastebin 'ls -la configs' or just mess around in there. If there's no target you probably need to run some sort of shell script in here
the tutorial on this page - http://buildroot.uclibc.org/buildroot.html#custom_busybox - says to run "make busybox-menuconfig"
And it's saying there's no target? Try going into the root directory of the source files (the folder the .tar.gz gave you) and just run 'make'.
when I run "sudo ./Config.in" I get: "sudo: ./Config.in: command not found"
If you're going to use sudo don't include the './'
when I run "sudo Config.in" I get: "sudo: Config.in: command not found"
running "make" in the buildroot directory throws these errors - http://pastebin.com/09pg1JTR
Ok now we're getting somewhere. Run 'sudo apt-get install ncurses-devel'
Do you just want this installed or do you want to compile it from source?
